meanings.definition: To shine brighter than something else.
meanings.sent1: The sun will outbeam the moon tonight.
meanings.sent2: Her smile seemed to outbeam all the stars in the sky.
meanings.sent3: The flashlight tried to outbeam the streetlights, but failed miserably.
meanings.sent4: His enthusiasm outbeamed everyone else's in the room.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse outbeamed the storm, guiding ships to safety.

meanings.definition: To surpass in brightness or brilliance.
meanings.sent1: The fireworks display will outbeam any other event in town.
meanings.sent2: Her intelligence outbeams all her classmates.
meanings.sent3: The new LED lights outbeam the old incandescent bulbs by far.
meanings.sent4: His artwork always manages to outbeam the competition.
meanings.sent5: The diamond's sparkle outbeams any other gemstone.
